meanings.definition: The front part or section of something.
meanings.sent1: The forepart of the car was damaged in the accident.
meanings.sent2: She always sits in the forepart of the classroom to see the board clearly.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to hide its toy in the forepart of the sofa.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was the forepart of his personality, always putting others first.
meanings.sent5: The forepart of the book had an intriguing illustration that caught her attention.

meanings.definition: The part of a ship's hull that is forward of the midship section.
meanings.sent1: The forepart of the ship was painted in a bright color to stand out at sea.
meanings.sent2: The captain stood at the forepart of the ship, scanning the horizon for land.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the forepart of the ship, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The forepart of the ship cut through the waves like a knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The forepart of the ship rose and fell with the rhythm of the ocean waves.
